abstract.li: Activity recording provides the necessary links to record what happens to a product, either as usage of the product, or by way of maintenance, or of anything else that is significant in the life of the product.

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of activity recording. The major difference between activity recording and work definition is that activity recording uses the 'Activity as realized' module to assert that the work described has actually taken place. In addition, the module enables the use of Observations to record things which were not allowed for in the definition of the work. Note that, although the majority of the content of the module relates to the use of Observation, this is of secondary importance to the use of Activity as realized, covering only a few per cent of the requirements.

inscope.li: recording the usage of a product;
recording the maintenance activities on a product;
recording the use of resources during usage of a product;
recording the use of resources during the maintenance of a product;
recording observations against a product or its support solution.

outscope.li: recording the status or configuration of a product;
defining a usage or maintenance of a product.
